divs: Sighting DetailsAt approximately 9:30 pm, I went out into my backyard like I always do with my binoculars to look at the cosmos. I had been out there for about 15 min. when all of a sudden, I happened upon these 4 star-like, spherical objects, probably at an altitude of about 100,000 ft., more or less, moving in erratic patterns, and at unbelievable speeds! When I first spotted the objects, they were grouped together, so perfectly that it's almost safe to say that the objects made a complete 360 degree square. All of a sudden, the objects just shot down, then to the left, and then up again. I stopped looking at the objects, thinking that it was just probably nothing, but I became curious, and happened to look up once more. And with luck, there were the objects, making the same maneuvers that they had the first time. I started to think, "Wow! I think I'm really seeing an UFO phenomenon!" So I put down my binoculars to put my glasses back on, looked up again, and the objects were gone! After the event, I ran inside and got online to report the UFO's. What really got me to notice the objects in the first place was the unbelievable speeds at which they moved. When I first saw the objects I thought that they were just a simple star cluster, but apparently I was wrong.
Summary: As I looked up into the southern hemisphere with my binoculars, I noticed 4 star-like, spherical objects moving in erratical patterns at unbelievable speeds.
trends: There have been 34 other sightings in Overland Park
There were no other sightings in Overland Park on or around June 23rd 2007
